visual_timeline.change: A whole lemon is stationary on a wooden cutting board. A hand with a knife hovers above.
The knife lowers and begins to press into the top surface of the lemon.
The knife steadily cuts through the lemon, revealing the internal flesh and some juice droplets.
The lemon is fully sliced into two halves, and the knife is slowly withdrawn, allowing the halves to separate slightly on the board.
Two distinct lemon halves rest on the cutting board. The knife and hand move out of the primary view.

objects.visual_state: whole, yellow, textured skin

objects.name: hand
objects.visual_state: visible, fair skin tone

objects.visual_state: metallic blade, dark handle (partially visible)
objects.interaction: held by hand, poised to cut

objects.name: cutting board
objects.visual_state: brown, wooden, clean surface

scent.reasoning: Intact rind offers minimal volatile release from surface waxes and dormant oil glands, resulting in a very faint scent.
